text:
Apple Watch one step away from 50% market share, but an awkward guest has arrived (photo)
The company to grow the most on the podium is Samsung, according to Strategy Analytics data
07 Nov 2019, 10:02 by Enrico Paccusse
Not that it was a novelty: Apple has complete dominance in the smartwatch market. This is what emerges from the analysis conducted by Strategy Analytics, which sees the apple company reaching peaks never explored, with 47.9% market share.
Only 2 percentage points are missing and the fateful half market share will be reached. It would mean that for every 2 smartwatches, one is branded Apple - a success that is hard to imagine at the outset, given the closure to other operating systems.
In general, the data nevertheless offers a healthy picture for the market, with a 42% increase in shipments compared to last year, with Samsung leading the best year-on-year growth (73%).
However, there is another big name that appears on the horizon, and Google, the fresh owner of the Fitbit brand, dropped from second to third place in the last year. Will Big G succeed in reviving its fortunes? The battle gets interesting.
